body_html:
I got that. There's plenty o ways to prevent or fix it (like using L1, L2 regularization while training).
That doesn't change the fact though that it somehow produces correct results when evaluated on GPU while going awry on CPU.

body:
I got that. There's plenty o ways to prevent or fix it (like using L1, L2 regularization while training).
That doesn't change the fact though that it somehow produces correct results when evaluated on GPU while going awry on CPU.
